meanings.definition: The quality or state of being awkward.
meanings.sent1: Her awkwardness in social situations made her feel self-conscious.
meanings.sent2: The awkwardness of the situation was palpable as they all stood in silence.
meanings.sent3: The awkwardness of the dance routine brought smiles to the audience's faces.
meanings.sent4: The awkwardness of the conversation hung in the air like a heavy cloud.
meanings.sent5: His awkwardness was like a bright neon sign, impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: The feeling of discomfort or embarrassment.
meanings.sent1: She blushed with awkwardness when she realized her mistake.
meanings.sent2: The awkwardness he felt at the party made him want to leave early.
meanings.sent3: His awkwardness at the party was so obvious, it became endearing to others.
meanings.sent4: The awkwardness of the situation weighed on her like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The awkwardness of the moment was etched in his memory forever.

meanings.definition: A lack of grace or coordination in movement or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His awkwardness on the dance floor was comical yet charming.
meanings.sent2: The awkwardness of his movements made it clear he was not a natural dancer.
meanings.sent3: The awkwardness of his attempts to juggle were met with laughter from the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her awkwardness in sports was like watching a baby deer learning to walk.
meanings.sent5: The awkwardness of his gestures was a sight to behold, like a clumsy ballet.
